intro: Micranthella havanensis, commonly known as the Cuban starflower, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant features delicate, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue, with five petals. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Micranthella havanensis is adapted to grow in moist, well-drained soils in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
